voter engagement model.reasoning: The voter engagement model refers to the specific framework or approach implemented within social work education to enhance voter participation, making it a clear methodological component of the study.
passages: This article describes the implementation of a voter engagement model in social work education.

pre- and post-tests.reasoning: Pre- and post-tests are specific assessment methods used to evaluate the effectiveness of the voter engagement model by measuring changes in participants' perceptions and behaviors before and after the intervention.
passages: Pre- and post-tests from 475 participants demonstrate the efficacy of this model in increasing social work students' perceived importance of voting to their practice
